text1: Each night, at precisely 18:01, an artificial sun
powered by the lamppost attached to the building in front
would shower warm yellow light into the apartment.
A sun that sleeps during the day
that seemed to only take notice of residents
living in 32 Boulevard du Temple.
That was the only reason why I stayed,
on this false pretense of being specially chosen.
I met you.
You had a very round face,
and everything about your personality lacked edges.
You were a ball of light or maybe even a cotton ball
or a tomato or a good piece of brioche.
I don’t know what happens to me when I face you.
I grow desperate.
It’s like there’s something emanating from my chest,
with a voice of its own: Love me! Pay attention to me!
Tell me I’m pretty! Tell me my heart is pretty!
I don’t understand why I want you so much.
You’re not all that, no offense, but I crave, crave, crave
your validation, your affection, your smile, your heat.
Please pay attention to me. Pretty please with a cherry on top.
text2: Walk, walk, walk to Prince Street and Greene Street.

walk to Broome Street.

Knock, knock, knock.
No one is answering.
Dialing…Dialing…
Oh Hey!

Couldn’t stop staring at World 2,
but I thought World 1 was far greater?
Scared happiness.
Convinced another person that spam is the best thing on Earth.
Super sexual jokes vs. Super strong margaritas.
So many jokes, Like a tennis ball, back and forth,
back and forth, back and forth.
Aye, yai, yai, they never grow up.
Words of wisdom: Men are just boys with more expensive toys.
“She loves gifts.”
“Yeah, she can be very materialistic...”
“She’s a present. She’s the cherry on top of the cake.
Me, I’m more like the filling of a donut.”
“Don’t talk down on yourself.”
“I love donuts, what do you mean?”
You read me “On Seeing the 100% Perfect Girl
One Beautiful April Morning” aloud in bed,
we stayed there, restless and rumpled,
until the word morning wasn’t morning,
we took walks around the neighborhood
and imagined what it would be like to be old and wearing cool hats,
and every meal had a taste of optimism for a while,
but in May, he texted me saying that he got a check-up
and it “turns out” he has an STD and that I should get tested
and believe it or not this was the second time he had given me an STD,
I felt so stupid, I asked him how he got it,
he lied to me on the phone,
he texted me later saying that he had met someone
before he came to see me in April,
I said how could you,
I can’t believe he lied to me,
hat I believed him when he said I was his 100% Perfect Girl,
he said we weren’t together back then,
and before I knew it I was stuck in the iconic FRIEND’s argument:
WE WERE ON A BREAK,
and I’d always thought that I was Rachel,
but I always thought it would feel good to be Rachel,
not this dirty and depressing and
AASDKFASDKFS,
aSJDFAKSDJFw,
SUGKASDGKS,
IERGIE,
SEIRGJS,
I didn’t tell anyone for a while because I was so embarrassed,
I couldn’t stop crying,
I cried, I cried, I cried, and I cried,
there was something wrong with my body,
the beat of my own heart made me tremble,
days went by, and it never felt better,
White sky, wet rain, timid steps.
Ping!
You sent me an email on New Year’s.
“You’re the person I’ve been the closest to in my life.”
You always do this.
You always pull me back with your pretty words.
My friend says I’m ‘emotional horny.’ Not this time.
text3: Of arms-length. Curled closely.
Found.
There, what I remember I had with you.
If you felt it, wouldn’t you let me know.
But your ego is as big as mine.
Orbiting. Not touching, not yet.

Ugh. 4:31 am.
Omg. The ceiling is leaking.
Wait, this is like actually bad.
Be calm. Is it that bad?
I can’t sleep with this sound.
No one is at the front desk.
Restroom break?
Red pen scrawled on ruled paper. Crumpled. Looks old.
Do they use this every night?
Doo, doo, doo.
Waiting.
Impatient.
Doo, doo, doo, makin’ my way to the Modern.
Press ‘C’ for cellar, walk, walk, walk, second elevator.
Hi, my ceiling is leaking.
It’s probably the Penthouse.
We don’t know which Penthouse it is.
I don’t want to wake up both at 5am.
What do I do.
Come check it out.
Could you wear a mask though.
Takes video.
Handyman will be here at 7am.
Short nap on the couch.
I put eyeliner on you.
The way I do my makeup doesn’t suit you,
but I smile from being so still, so close to you.
You were sitting on the toilet, I think we were both a bit tipsy.
I love getting ready and hoped you didn’t find me too superficial.
You never see the bad in me.
I took you to Angel’s Share.
I got a cocktail called Matcha Meadow,
and you, a cocktail called Flirtibird.
I knew what you were thinking of me,
but I just wanted to make sure.
It was November 19, and I showed you
the shirt that I had been eyeing.
You said you wanted it.
I was afraid you were gonna get it for yourself,
but we made our way down Orchard Street.
I thought it was Orchid Street.
Space Needle, Space Noodle, tomato, tomato.
It started raining, and we had to share my Hello Kitty umbrella.
I had an excuse to lock my arm into yours.
Rain-loving. Your arm is so warm, so muscular, so handsome.
It’s not even a tap anymore.
My room is a waterfall, and I am panicking.
We called the plumber but they couldn’t find the source of the problem,
he made holes in the ceiling,
and I went to bed between two gaping black squares in the sky,
hugging the fear that a rat would fall on me in my sleep.
You want to buy thank-you gifts for me and Jeffrey.
We go back to November 19, sticky and giggly.
The guy only half recognises us,
and I tell him it’s because we are sweating.
You get me the shirt.
I love you for it, not for the shirt,
but for being the one that fulfilled a destiny in my life.
You and destiny are in tandem.
text4: Two matcha meadows.
A guy in a bejewelled Hello Kitty top hits on you.
I am slightly annoyed.
It is 32 C and we have an hour until your train.
We are just in time for the bus, where I think about
what to write to you so that you will always remember this trip:
You make my heart happy.
Like snowflakes...
Singing.
You make my heart sing in a matcha meadow.
Makes me jump, jump, jump the joy out of my heart.
You kiss my head in the elevator
and that is when I knew that we will always be
Agreeable, moving in a circle, as if inscribed.
text5: “You Lovebug” she says, as she squeezes in a hug.
I feel sad that you’re not here.
I think back to a time when I didn’t know you
and realize that back then, I couldn’t imagine
someone as admirable, obstructive, extra-beautiful as you.
I breathe hope.
Like whoever I’m going to meet next,
they’ll surpass my wildest dreams today.
Like I’m within the margin, between the leaves,
eating sunlight, growing stronger, ready for the next form of you.
There were many things I wanted to do but I was already so happy,
I didn’t feel like I needed anything more at all.
So I didn’t talk to anyone at the book launch and
just got my books and my glass of orange and walked away.
So I didn’t go to the Gemini party
and went to go meet Jeffrey for dinner.
We ate oysters at Jeffrey’s.
I think my cocktail was called Spill the Tea.
I have not stopped being tipsy since 2pm.
I am Healing, full of freckles.

text1: Chaque nuit, à précisément 18h01, un soleil artificiel
alimenté par le lampadaire fixé au bâtiment en face
inonderait l’appartement d’une chaude lumière jaune.
Un soleil qui dormait le jour et
ne semblait remarquer que les résidents
du 32 Boulevard du Temple.
C'était la seule raison pour laquelle j’y restais,
sur cette fausse prétention d'être spécialement choisi.
Je t'ai rencontré.
Tu avais un visage très rond,
et toute ta personnalité manquait de contours.
Tu étais une boule de lumière ou peut-être même de coton
ou une tomate ou une bonne brioche moelleuse.
Je ne sais pas ce qui m'arrive quand je te fais face.
Je deviens désespérée.
C'est comme s'il y avait quelque chose qui émanait de ma poitrine,
avec une voix à part entière: Aime-moi ! Fais attention à moi !
Dis-moi que je suis jolie ! Dis-moi que mon cœur est joli !
Je ne comprends pas pourquoi je te veux autant.
Tu n’es pas tout ça, sans vouloir t’offenser, mais je désire, désire, désire
ta validation, ton affection, ton sourire, ta chaleur.
S'il te plaît, fais attention à moi. S'il te plaît avec une cerise par-dessus.

d’avant en arrière, d’avant en arrière

Moi, je suis plutôt comme la garniture d'un beignet.'

Tu m'as lu 'À propos de ma rencontre avec la fille 100% parfaite
par un beau matin d’avril' à voix haute dans le lit,
on est resté là, agités et froissés,
jusqu'à ce que le mot 'matin' ne soit plus 'matin',
on a fait des promenades dans le quartier et imaginé
ce que cela ressemblerait d'être vieux et de porter des chapeaux cool,
et chaque repas avait un goût d'optimisme pendant un moment,
mais en mai, il m'a envoyé un texto en disant qu'il avait fait un test
et qu'il 's'avérait' qu'il avait une MST et que je devais me faire tester
et croyez-le ou non, c'était la deuxième fois qu'il m'en donnait une,
je me sentais tellement stupide, je lui ai demandé comment il l'avait attrapée,
il m'a menti au téléphone,
il m'a envoyé un texto plus tard en disant qu'il avait rencontré quelqu'un
avant de venir me voir en avril,
j'ai dit comment as-tu pu,
je ne peux pas croire qu'il m'a menti,
que je l'ai cru qu’il me considérait comme sa fille 100% prafaite,
il a dit que nous n'étions pas ensemble à l'époque,
et avant que je ne m'en rende compte, j'étais coincée dans l'emblématique argument de FRIENDS :
ON ÉTAIT EN PAUSE,
et j'ai toujours pensé que j'étais Rachel,
mais j'ai toujours pensé que ça ferait du bien d'être Rachel,
pas sale et déprimée et
AASDKFASDKFS,

le battement de mon propre cœur me faisait trembler,

Ciel blanc, pluie mouillée, pas timides.

en mouvement dans un cercle, comme inscrits.
